awd_abstract_narration: This proposal is to develop and test mathematical models of the                 growth and decline of organizations.  Five models, differing in                 details of processes internal to organizations and of their                     external surrounding, are proposed.  The goal is to understand                  forces shaping organizational structures over long time spans,                  and to provide a theoretical structure for explaining how or-                   ganizational change produces changes in society.  The work grows                out of previous work by the PI and collaborators.  PI will                      evaluate models by comparison with data on the founding, growth,                and mortality of diverse industries: labor unions, banks, life                  insurance firms, and breweries.  The project seeks to develop a                 set of theories and methodological tools cutting across specific                types of organizations, for use in further studies of organi-                   zational ecology.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Social and Economic Sciences
